macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Markets Rise on January 27 Amid Anticipation of Fed Meeting
items.summary: The S&P 500 (US500) rose to 6976 points, gaining 0.37%, while on January 26 it hit 6965 points up 0.72%; Dow Jones added 0.4%, Nasdaq gained 0.6% with tech and communications leading.

items.title: Major Indices Decline for Second Straight Week on Tariff and Geopolitical Worries
items.summary: Dow, S&P 500, and Nasdaq fell last week due to disappointing forecasts and tensions, though late rebound in big tech and positive data mitigated losses; Energy and Materials outperformed.

items.title: Global Stocks Hit Peaks, Gold Surges Past $5,000 as Markets Eye Fed Decision
items.summary: MSCI All Country index reached new high, Wall Street's big three posted gains but Russell 2000 fell; Japanese stocks down 2% on yen rally, with speculation on intervention ahead of Fed meeting.

items.title: Fed Meeting Looms with Odds Favoring Steady Rates, Possible 25bp Cut
items.summary: FOMC meets this week, likely to hold rates but a 25 basis point cut possible; markets brace for earnings from Boeing, UPS, GM, UnitedHealth, RTX and economic data like consumer confidence.

items.title: US PCE Inflation Steady at 0.2% Monthly, 2.7-2.8% Yearly
items.summary: PCE Price Index rose 0.2% in October and November 2025, core also 0.2%; yearly at 2.7% October and 2.8% November, amid prior government shutdown delays.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Faces Selling Pressure with Stablecoin Drop and Mining Hashrate Collapse
items.summary: Bitcoin is under mounting selling pressure as January 2026 ends, driven by a $2.24 billion drop in stablecoin market cap, year-low Coinbase premium indicating US selling, and a sharp hashrate decline from a US ice storm. Veteran trader Peter Brandt warns of a potential fall below $70,000 if pressures persist.

items.title: Binance Records Largest Weekly Outflows Since November 2025
items.summary: Binance experienced over $6 billion in net outflows across BTC, ETH, and USDT in the past week, marking its largest weekly outflows since November 2025 amid broader market liquidity concerns.

items.title: BitGo Launches First Crypto IPO of 2026
items.summary: BitGo became the first cryptocurrency firm to go public in 2026 via IPO, seeing an initial podcast-driven pop before sliding below its listing price by week's end.

items.title: Clarity Act Stalled in Senate Over Stablecoin Yield Rules
items.summary: The Clarity Act, aimed at providing regulatory structure for crypto, remains uncertain and stalled in Senate sub-committees due to disputes over stablecoin yield rules, though insiders see potential momentum.

items.title: Binance Files for Pan-European MiCA License in Greece
items.summary: Binance has set up a holding company in Greece and filed for a pan-European MiCA license, which becomes mandatory for EU crypto firms from July 1.

items.title: ZBD Raises $40M for Crypto Payments in Video Games
items.summary: Startup ZBD, backed by Bitcoin pioneers, raised $40 million from Blockstream Capital to develop crypto-based payment models for video games, aiming to succeed where prior tie-ups failed.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: NTT DATA Releases Technology Foresight Report 2026 Highlighting Six AI Trends
items.summary: NTT DATA announced its annual Technology Foresight Report 2026 on January 27, identifying six key trends including human-orchestrated autonomy and embodied agency with emotions, emphasizing mass intelligence and business strategies for AI adaptation.

items.title: RIKEN Partners with Argonne, Fujitsu, and NVIDIA to Advance AI for Science and HPC
items.summary: RIKEN signed a Memorandum of Understanding with Argonne National Laboratory, Fujitsu, and NVIDIA on January 27 to collaborate on AI, high-performance computing, and quantum technologies for breakthroughs in life sciences, materials, and climate research.

items.title: Singapore Unveils New Framework for Governing Agentic AI
items.summary: On January 27, Singapore's Infocomm Media Development Authority released a framework for governing agentic AI systems that act autonomously, addressing risks and ethical considerations in AI deployment.

items.title: University at Buffalo AI Model Predicts Cardiac Patient Readmissions with 95% Accuracy
items.summary: Published January 26, researchers developed a machine learning model integrating patient-reported data that predicts 90-day hospital readmissions for cardiac patients at 95% accuracy, aiming to prevent unnecessary hospitalizations.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Highguard Finally Launches Despite Rocky Marketing Campaign
items.summary: Highguard has officially released after a controversial marketing reveal. Early impressions from gameplay suggest the game is quite good despite the marketing challenges.

items.title: Code Vein II Review: Bloodsucking The Fun Away
items.summary: Code Vein II receives a negative review, with critics finding the game unremarkable and forgettable once its inspirations are removed.

items.title: Konami Gaming Appoints Deron Hunsberger as VP of North American Sales
items.summary: Konami Gaming has named Deron Hunsberger as vice president of North American game sales, bringing 25 years of customer partnership experience to the role.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Trump Administration Implements Section 232 Tariffs on Semiconductors
items.summary: Effective January 15, 2026, new 25% tariffs target logic integrated circuits and related products under Section 232, with exemptions for U.S. data centers, repairs, R&D, startups, consumer electronics, civil industrial, and public sector uses. The policy includes investigations into broader semiconductor products like substrates, wafers, and downstream electronics.

items.title: Trump Announces Reciprocal Tariff Framework Capping Rates at 15%
items.summary: On January 15, 2026, the administration outlined a trade framework limiting reciprocal tariffs to no more than 15%, alongside Section 232 tariffs on auto parts. Updates as of January 26 note ongoing enforcement priorities against tariff evasion.
